themes.name: AI Compute and Power Bottleneck
themes.description: Sustained investment in training and inference capacity is constrained by power availability, driving outsized demand for advanced semiconductors, high-bandwidth memory, optical interconnects, liquid cooling, data center REIT development, and utility-scale generation and grid connections; electrical equipment suppliers, EPCs, and regulated utilities with approved capex plans are positioned to benefit.

themes.name: Edge AI and Automation Diffusion
themes.description: Shift of AI workloads from cloud to edge catalyzes refresh cycles in PCs and smartphones with NPUs, ADAS content in autos, factory automation and robotics, and vertical AI software; beneficiaries include device OEMs and component suppliers, industrial automation vendors, embedded AI software platforms, and testing and inspection providers.

themes.name: US Industrial Policy and Reshoring Build-Out
themes.description: CHIPS, IRA, and IIJA dollars continue to flow into semiconductor fabs, battery and EV supply chains, grid and transportation infrastructure, and clean manufacturing, favoring construction and engineering firms, specialty contractors, building materials, electrical equipment and cables, factory automation, and select rail and trucking logistics; domestic suppliers with capacity and permitting advantages gain share.

themes.name: Grid Modernization and Electrification Capex
themes.description: Aging T&D infrastructure, data center load growth, EV and building electrification, and resilience mandates extend a multi-year grid upgrade cycle, supporting transformers, switchgear, protection relays, high-voltage cables, distributed energy resources, smart meters, and utility capex earners; long backlogs and pricing power persist for constrained components.

themes.name: Metabolic Health (GLP-1) Adoption and Healthcare Second-Order Effects
themes.description: Rising GLP-1 use in diabetes and obesity expands revenue for innovators and their supply chains (injectables, CDMOs, cold-chain, delivery tech) while reshaping utilization and mix across managed care, medtech, and wellness; watch for oral formulations, cardiovascular outcome data, manufacturing scale-ups, and coverage decisions that impact distributors, pharmacies, and PBMs.

themes.name: Global Rearmament and Cybersecurity Spend
themes.description: Geopolitical tensions sustain elevated defense and cyber budgets with emphasis on munitions, air and missile defense, C4ISR, space, and secure communications; primes and sub-tier suppliers in propulsion, sensors, RF, and electronics benefit alongside cybersecurity platforms focused on identity, endpoint, cloud, and AI-driven threat detection.

themes.name: Consumer Barbell and Ad Spend Shift to Retail Media and CTV
themes.description: Higher living costs and tighter credit drive trade-down at the low end while premium categories and experiences remain resilient, benefiting value retailers, club formats, off-price, and luxury; advertising dollars consolidate with platforms offering high ROI and closed-loop measurement, accelerating retail media networks, performance social, and connected TV, with positive spillovers to ad-tech and payments.

themes.name: Higher-for-Longer Cost of Capital and Balance-Sheet Discipline
themes.description: An elevated cost of capital versus the 2010s rewards companies with pricing power, free cash flow, and conservative leverage while pressuring long-duration and capital-intensive models; beneficiaries include insurers and brokers in hard markets, selective banks with stable deposits and fee income, cash-rich tech and industrials, and buyback or dividend growers, while overlevered CRE and rate-sensitive yield proxies remain challenged.
